environment.GUI.views

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • environment.GUI.views.Graph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimulatorView<Station>

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimulatorView<Station>
    A graphical view of the simulation. This class uses a singleton pattern and the instance of this class is returned by getInstance().
    Version:
    27/04/2017
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    JFrame, JPanel, SimulatorView

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Graph.Entry
      Stores all the Statistics from the Station that is passed to the Graph each tick of the Simulator.
      private class  Graph.GraphPanel
      This Graph.GraphPanel denotes a graph on screen.
      private static class  Graph.StatisticType
      All the values and encapsulated functionality of the elements that will be added to the statisticTypes.
      private static class  Graph.VehicleType
      All the values and encapsulated functionality of the elements that will be added to the vehicleTypes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedTransferQueue<Station> buffer
      Acts as a buffer between the main thread and the drawer.
      private javax.swing.JButton closeButton
      The button that closes the window and, if the simulation is still running, the simulation also.
      private int currentTick
      The most recent tick number that the simulation has passed to Graph using show(int, Station)
      private java.lang.Thread drawer
      This Thread waits for a snapshot of the Station to be added to the buffer and then once there is a element in buffer it removes it and uses the snapshot to update the graph on screen.
      private static Graph GRAPH
      The single instance of Graph.
      private Graph.GraphPanel graphPanel
      The JPanel that denotes the drawn graph on screen.
      private int height
      The height of the Graph JFrame.
      boolean isClosed
      Holds whether the this Graph.
      private javax.swing.JComboBox<Graph.StatisticType> statisticTypes
      This combo box holds the options for which Statistic is displayed on graph.
      private javax.swing.JComboBox<Graph.VehicleType> vehicleTypes
      This combo box holds the options for which Statistic is displayed on graph.
      private int width
      The width of the Graph JFrame.
      private javax.swing.JFrame window
      The JFrame that house the Graph view on the Screen.

      • drawer

        private java.lang.Thread drawer
        This Thread waits for a snapshot of the Station to be added to the buffer and then once there is a element in buffer it removes it and uses the snapshot to update the graph on screen.
        See Also:
        LinkedTransferQueue, Thread

      • buffer

        Acts as a buffer between the main thread and the drawer.

      • height

        private int height
        The height of the Graph JFrame. All the elements of this Graph are scales to width and height value.

        The width of the Graph JFrame. All the elements of this Graph are scales to width and height value.

      • show

        public void show(int time,
                 Station station)
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorView
        Show the status of a T object.

        Must be overridden in classes that implement the SimulationView.

        Specified by:
        show in interface SimulatorView<Station>
        Parameters:
        time - The time of elapsed within the current T object.
        station - The details of the object which is an instance of T status.

      • setEnd

        public void setEnd()
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorView
        Set the SimulatorView to terminate.

        Flag the SimulatorView to terminate either when:

        • This method is called
        • When the SimulatorView has finished execution

        Specified by:
        setEnd in interface SimulatorView<Station>
